alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:55PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimball and southwestern Banner Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Albin, or 17 miles northwest of Kimball, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Kimball and southwestern Banner Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
